content: this legal case involves a dispute between two parties kk and dd over multiple real estate properties another party do was ordered to pay a certain amount to kk within 15 days the court made a decision based on the property act and a partitioning plan prepared by experts the total market value of the properties was determined and the coownership shares were valued accordingly the experts proposed dividing the property based on cadastral parcels taking into account the wishes of the coowners and following professional rules however there were some deviations in certain areas of crops due to the coowners wishes the coowner who received a larger share must compensate the other coowner for the difference in value as a result of the division one party gained ownership rights to 21 properties valued at a certain amount while the other party gained ownership rights to 10 properties valued at a different amount the party that received a smaller amount needs to compensate the other party with a greater amount according to the property law coowners can terminate coownership of multiple things at the same time and the court may assign specific things or a group of things proportionally based on the coownership shares if the value of the things assigned to an individual coowner exceeds their coownership share they are obligated to compensate the other coowners for the difference additionally any payment made by the coowners creates a lien on the property allocated to the applicant for termination
